name: V & T
address: 1024 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA

reviews.text:
We were warmly greeted when we entered and seated right away. Service was fast & personable.

Small, charming, old world atmosphere.

We ordered salad and a pepperoni / sausage pizza. The servings were generous and the food delicious.
Endroit dÃ©couvert par hasard, super cuisine et personnel trÃ¨s agrÃ©able
Good place to eat on the upper west side. You can dine outdoors

I ordered the shrimp scampi, the shrimp were overcooked. Chewy.
The appetizer calamari was good, served hot.

A family staple! Growing up my mother would take me here and it was my introduction to Italian cuisine. Almost 40 years later I'm carrying the tradition to my family. "Never disappointed, never leave hungry, AND still have takeout for later"
Pranzato durante un soggiorno a NYC a fine aprile, rimasto entusiasta dell'ottima qualita' della pizza.
I love their pizza!! The sauce is sooo good!
Fantastic food, good service, cozy atmosphere

The best pizza I've ever had (and I'm an old guy now who lived in NYC). Salads are also first rate and Aldo (who's been there forever) is simply the best and coolest waiter you'll ever want to meet. GO THERE
Superior pizzas & Italian dishes. Polite service! I love the house special everything pizza! Large wine collection,
Food was bland and overpriced. I would go somewhere else if you're looking for authentic Italian.

Owner just tried to attack my mom ???
Stole our credit card, intoxicated during work hour â€” long post !!

Context:
Just dined in at this restaurantâ€”I consider myself an occurring customer as Iâ€™ve ate in this establishment for years.

The servers gave us such attitude. After we ordered, my relative noticed how they would point and laugh behind (my) back. They had no manners/customer service. It felt discriminating due to our obvious age category & the way we dressed. He kept rushing us to order like he had somewhere to go (fyi, the restaurant closed in like 2 hours)
After we got our check, he refused to let us pay until we said yes to giving him an 8 dollar tip (which was the minimum to him). He essentially forced us to tip him for horrible service. We said yes because we were the only people in the restaurant, at a late timeâ€”itâ€™s not really safe so we just gave in.
What we ordered: pasta $20, chicken fingers & fries ($18) + a coke ($3). Which equals to = $41

With tax it was $44.63. Ok thatâ€™s fine ?

We had the exact money for what we owed, no money for tip. Yet we didnâ€™t allow us to pay until we gave him an $8 tip. Which is crazy because we were 2 adolescent. Tip isnâ€™t necessary, itâ€™s a courtesy. He didnâ€™t deserve a tip anyways due to the lack of respect given.

He held onto my friendâ€™s credit card until we said yes. So after we got home (less than a 5 minute walk), we told our parents what had happened. They went to go speak with the manager, my mother called me as she was doing soâ€”and he was attempting to attack my mom. I ran as soon as I heard that, arrived to the restaurant.

We then find out they said we picked upâ€”instead of dined in. When one of the waiters saw me thatâ€™s when he â€œfinally knew who I wasâ€ (an excuse, trying to hide the fact they stole). I kept saying that we ate indoors, yet he told our parents we had taken out (which is an insane lie for 8 dollars). He stopped attacking my mom but by this point he was attempting to argue with me, and that waiter had left.

We didnâ€™t feel safe enough to banter back with the server as he went up in my faceâ€”breath reeking with alcohol (weâ€™re underage, the only people dining inâ€”besides the owners and HIS friends). Not sure in what world was there someone being served wine.  He was certainly not in the right headspace to be in charge of money.

The owner and the waiter in black lied and said we did a pick it upâ€”hence why we got charged. Which is a complete lie because when I got there to protect my mom after hearing the owner attempt to attack her, the waiter in black â€œrecognizedâ€ me and said I was there. Contradicting what theyâ€™ve said.

Iâ€™m truly disgusted because Iâ€™ve had wonderful memories here with family & friends, never discriminatedâ€”until now, the waiters are rude and the white lady at the cashier (not the usual lady I see, whoâ€™s more kind)
When I ordered, I asked for chicken fingers & French fries while pointing at the kids menu ($12) as I lack appetite. I always order a lasagna so I wouldnâ€™t know the difference between the kids vs regular meal. So they gave me an $18 acknowledging I wouldnâ€™t know the difference between the two.

Being judged for not being a certain in a restaurant everyone can go to (Iâ€™ve been to this restaurant and had poc as waiters, and a nice cashier who was also poc)â€”so itâ€™s funny that I was judged, based off my clothes (pants and a shirt) to a restaurant that isnâ€™t even fancy at all.

Donâ€™t ever come here, better for you and your wallet. Our stomachs hurt after eating the food, not sure what they did.

Iâ€™ve been going to this restaurant since the 1970s and I have never been disappointed. I used to live in the neighborhood and have long since moved, but whenever I happen to be over in that side of town, thatâ€™s the place for me and any of the members of my family to go. My all-time favorite of their is the shrimp Parmesan. No one elseâ€™s can compare !
There service isnâ€™t good

I haven't eaten here in over 10yrs & it's still the same great quality. I don't know where to start the garlic bread, the chicken parm or the sauce. What I do know is you should savor your meal here.  Take your time  with it enjoy a glass of wine or a beer with your meal. You will not be disappointed

Been coming here since 1977 after college and it thankfully doesnâ€™t change!!!  My favorite pizza place on earth (and Iâ€™ve been around).  I donâ€™t  live in the City any more but I make sure I hit V&T every time Iâ€™m there. Itâ€™s sooo good!!

I've known V&Ts for over 50 years. They make the best pizza in NYC - without question.  The house and the ceasar salads are great. Check out the photos of the luminaries that have eaten here - there's a reason.
Delicioso, abundante. Pedir para compartir sin duda.

Has a very local vibe.
Food was good
Had the chicken Marsala which was tasty
Service was friendly
Dark wood, delicious pizza, relaxed service, amazing menu, old-timey vibe. A relaxed joy of a place. I will be back!
I was hungry so I ate it

This is hands down my favorite restaurant to go to in all of NYC. It's a shame I don't live closer... excellent pizza at unbelievable prices. The atmosphere is unbeatable. You can get dessert here as well, or make a trip to the Hungarian Pastry Shop next door. I can't think of a better way to spend an evening!

The pizzas are delicious and cooked just right.  I have been there a few times and have not been disappointed.  There is a nice variety of pizzas but my favorite is the house meat special pizza.  They have a bar and offer beer on tap.

Ordered a vegan cheese for a severe dairy allergy. They sent me a regular cheese pie & refused to listen to me when I called explaining that it wasnâ€™t right. I had someone taste it to confirm its regular cheese and not veganâ€” from the wayâ€¦

Came as a group of 5 (1 person had been there before and recommended we go).  Being a Saturday night, I called in route to see if there was a waitlist to add our name to as we were 15-20 min away.  Because we were a larger group, they were happy to hold their last big table for us as a reservation.  Our waiter could answer specific questions about how things were prepared (for various dietary restrictions) and made recommendations based on what he enjoyed as well as popular menu items.  We all shared a few salads, 5 different entrees (including chicken parm, rigatoni, etc), and an assortment of desserts.  Great service and experience all around.  Thank you.
Our go to pizza restaurant.

This italian restaurant is top tier in my opinion. Classic dishes, delicious food. I've never had an issues for the 32 years of dining in and ordering out. The pizza is awesome and always made to my liking, the pasta dishes are amazing and always made to my liking. I can order when they first open or just before they close and the food remains the same!! wonderful place to eat and wonderful people who work there. Not to mention my mother has been eating here as a kid- they have a history of delicious italian food and serving the community!!
Love it
They have good pizza. They give free water

V & T is a cozy Italian spot with a casual atmosphere, but the food left me feeling somewhat underwhelmed. I started with the calamari, which arrived hot and freshâ€”a promising sign.

Unfortunately, the meat was quite thin, and the batter was overly thick, overpowering the delicate flavor of the calamari itself.

As for the pizza, it was decent but not particularly memorable. The crust had a nice texture, but the overall flavor profile didnâ€™t stand out.

While the experience wasnâ€™t bad, it also didnâ€™t wow me. If youâ€™re in the area and craving Italian, it might be worth a visit, but I wouldnâ€™t go out of my way for it.
Garbage. See pic.
20å¹´æ¥å®¶æ—ã§é€šã†ãŠæ°—ã«å…¥ã‚Šã®ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ³
This place is amazing. The food is delicious ğŸ˜‹ We had a great time
Delicious food and best customer service. Alex the owner is so accommodatingâ€” this place is old school and awesome!!
Food is delicious

I had a disappointing experience with this location. I placed an online order and received a confirmation, but no further updates. After waiting for an hour and assuming the food was ready, I went to pick it up. The front desk attendant glared at me, claimed they had called (though I hadnâ€™t received any call), and then carelessly tossed the pizza across the counter.

When I got home, I realized it wasnâ€™t even the right order. The pizza was cold and the wrong size, not matching what I had paid for.

Iâ€™ve visited this location before without any issues, so Iâ€™m hoping this was just a glitch in the ordering system and a mix-up at pickup. However, I really hope the service improves in the future.
Standard slice.  Better than dollar pizza, but didnâ€™t like the sauce that much
Family friendly restaurant with friendly staff, offering delicious Italian dishes and pizza at reasonable prices
Better find another place.
Great service food was delicious and so were the drinks

The food may be good, but the service is the worst I've experienced so far. It took a long, dreadful wait to get the menu and an even longer time to get the food. The staff could definitely be trained to be less rude and serve with more courtesy.

We placed an order it didnâ€™t arrive to correct apartment .When I called to speak to a manager named Anthony who claimed to be in charge . He said  I am not giving you your money or food back!! Call your credit card company Veey dismissiveâ€¦

We have gone to V&T for over 30 years. For many years their pizza and food was unbeatable. The problem with this restaurant is inconsistency. Sometimes the order is spot on, and sometimes the order is awful. The inconsistency started about 3 years or so ago. I suspect new family taking over and either not caring,  or not trained. Most recently, last Tuesday, 9/30/24 we ordered a pizza with a tri Colore Salad. (in the past the salad was fantastic, therefore we reordered.) Since it was the night of the VP debate, we ordered early. Around 5 ish. The pizza was the usual great pizza this time, but the salad was awful! The tri colore salad was basically a chopped up head of red cabbage or some red lettuce variation, with a few strands of lettuce. We tried to call and complain, but couldn't get through. I believe that V&T feels that since a large amount of their business is students, and students come and go, they can send out garbage without worry. This is especially easy for them since they are on the university meal plan. They have an easy gig. It is easy to rip off the students since they are busy and don't complain like us, awful long time customers. V&T, please just post that you do not want long time customers and save us the hassle of ordering from you.

Stepping into this restaurant really throws you into the American - Italian classics. A generous menu with all the classics. There are vegetarian options and while there isn't a kids menu: a fair selection of pizza,  pasta shapes  and sauces is guaranteed to keep them engaged.  Finish off with classic Italian sweets and a decent espresso, then head out for a walk along the Hudson River. The service was very accommodating and friendly, moderate to high prices.

Today I purchased a large pizza half sasauge and pepperoni the crust was burnt and I went back then the crust was paper thin the second time this cost me $25 very disappointed spoke to the person who took my order stating nothing they could do,  First time and last will not be recommending this restaurant.

This place is the best local Italian in my area that isnâ€™t over priced. I never mind spending for this food because itâ€™s very well worth it. Italian good made with so much love & always nice & hot. I always buy the chicken parm with the garlic bread with cheese and I tell you, no restaurant tops this one for me. AMAZING !!
V&T is an old school Italian staple in the neighborhood. Have been going to for years. Have a martini and then red wine with your amazing dinner. Great service and incredible food! Thank you V&T.

Such a delightful spot!! Really enjoyed the food, and everyone working there was just so fun and sweet. Especially shout-out to the older man working there (the owner?). He's fantastic! (But then, so was everyone else, and the food)

The eggplant had a cold center. The soda was flat. The salad dressing not mixed. The people are sweet though. But my tip is just be sure you are on top of the kitchen to get you the right things the way you wanted them.

Celebrating and enjoying quality time with my mother. We had lunch here after a home-going celebration for one of our dear loved ones. So a hearty Italian meal was best for the job. V & T did not disappoint! Flavor was robust and the cheeses blended together like the beautiful dynamic harmony of your favorite love song. Canâ€™t wait to go back!

Great find during our trip to New York and area late last year!  Place felt authentic and food was excellent.  This is near the big cathedral, a great place for lunch & dinner - we both ordered pizza - crust was thin and light, sauce had aâ€¦

Great Italian restaurant. Family feel everyoneâ€™s very nice. The food is delicious. Iâ€™ve been coming here since I was a kid and it never disappoints. Iâ€™ve ate almost everything in the menu and itâ€™s all delicious. My personal favorite is their vodka pasta amazing!

Was hungry and past this place on getting some cookies and we smelled the pizza and it smelled delicious. So we decided to come in.

Thereâ€™s 2 parts of the restaurant. The servers didnâ€™t look happy and barely spoke. You say something and then they leave, like it feels you got ignored. But at least they heard you and got what you wanted.

I got pasta e fagioli soup. Definitely not worth the $7. Didnâ€™t taste good. We also got mozzarella sticks they were average. Not the best but not the worst. My brother said they were frozen, you can taste the after taste.

They also bring out fresh bread and butter which is delicious.

I got broiled pork chops with mashed potatoes. They are 2 thick pieces with some onions and mushrooms and I think garlic on top. It was good. The mash potatoes needed some more salt and a bit of different flavoring, but was okay. My brother and sister got the pepperoni pizza. It was thin and okay.

Decent food and a nice old NY Italian atmosphere. I think this place is known for great pizza, we chose to have chicken dishes. Bread was great, we had a good bottle of wine, the Chicken Vinny was a decent dish, enjoyed the pink sauce but the chicken was not as flavorful or textured for the dishes potential.

I honestly don't think I'll be going back here any time soon. I mean it's okay, but the wait was too long for what we got. The chicken I ordered was so overcooked that I didn't want to eat it. Far too overpriced for what you get as well.â€¦

Have been coming here for years, as great as ever. Our favorite Italian place in the heart of Upper West Side. Amazing food and desserts. This is the kind of place that gets busier with locals as the night goes on.

Very pleasant dining experience. Food was superb. Got the House special Pizza. I was unable to finish it as I was full after eating half of it. Pasta Carbonara unreal and the best Italian bread I ever tasted.
Highly recommended.

Our English pronunciation teacher (James) recommended us this place as he has visited it since he attended college 50 years ago. The pizzas and salad were delicious. They prepare their food in a very traditional way, which combined with the almost intact decoration, according to James, can make you feel like you have travelled back in time to the Old New York. Recently, we tried, apart from the always fresh Pizza, the House Salad, Chicken Caesar Salad, and the Broiled Pork Chops. Don't leave whithout trying the variety of desserts the my have to offer.

Nuestro profesor de pronunciaciÃ³n de InglÃ©s y gran amigo (James) nos recomendÃ³ este lugar ya que lo ha visitado desde que asistiÃ³ a la universidad hace 50 aÃ±os. Las pizzas y la ensalada estaban deliciosas. Preparan su comida de una forma muy tradicional, lo que combinado con la decoraciÃ³n casi intacta, segÃºn James, puede hacerte sentir como si hubieras viajado en el tiempo al Viejo Nueva York. Recientemente probamos, ademÃ¡s de la siempre fresca Pizza, la Ensalada de la Casa, la Ensalada CÃ©sar con Pollo y las Chuletas de Cerdo Asadas. No te quedes sin probar la variedad de postres que tienen para ofrecerte.

We had a wonderful group outing here. The food was excellent. We had a large party and had a lot of different appetizers, dinners, and a dessert. I had the Chicken Vinny which was awesome. There were a few orders of chicken and eggplantâ€¦

We smelled this place walking by and remarked on how good the pizza smelled. Then we ate at Kikoo Sushi, which while good, had a 30-40 delay between orders and just decided we'd pick up a pizza after our first order.

We did not regret it. The pizza was delicious and the portions were very large. It smelled great all the way home and reheated very well in the oven the next day too. I only wish I got more than one pie.

The service, portions, and prices are good, but the pizza is bad. I got a small meatball pizza. The sauce was good, although it did not save or redeem the pizza. 7/10. The cheese was okay 5/10. But the crust  ruined it. Completely charred black with no flavor or texture. A good pizza slice isn't supposed to be firm, but their pizza slice head about as much firmness as a piece of toilet paper. They accidentally gave me a serving spoon with a pizza, and honestly judging by the crust it probably wasn't a mistake. 2/10.
Overall, I give it a 4/10. They could probably pass this off somewhere other than New York City, but not here.

Big and not quite dead roaches in ladies' room... which were still there 90 mins after we told waiter (who giggled!)  We were  still there 90 mins later due to excruciatingly slow and inattentive service.  Vodka sauce tasted great, but waiter brought wrong dishes out TWICE!   Underneath the bar is dripping pipe with puddle (zoom in  photo).

Meh. The dough was decent but the mushrooms are from can. I was highly disappointed.
We also wanted the small pizza and the waiter said itâ€™s too small so we went forâ€¦

This place is amazing! I went with my mom for her birthday and we got there around 5, was empty so we were seated immediately. The waiter was friendly. We got the mozzarella sticks (which brought 6, we just ate 2 before the photo) and they were so much better than the frozen kind most restaurants sell. The manicotti parm I got was AMAZING, tasted so fresh. My mom's meatball and peppers parm sandwich was a 5/5. Had tender meatballs and had a homemade quality. Dessert we had spumoni gelato and OMG that pistachio gelato was beautiful. However there were no nuts and candied fruit like the menu showed so idk. But regardless I would totally go back.

Amazing food here. The place was not crowded at all. We received amazing service and food. Freshness and taste was off the charts. Didnâ€™t feel touristy and all. But did feel very authentic. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good meal.

Excellent food.  You should stop by and try it
Very authentic and great portions
Salad, bread and my shrimp fettuccine Alfredo
Walked in to this place with family for italian food. We got pizza and a chicken dish and salad. It was all good and reasonably priced.
Great service. Amazing and unique cheesy pizza. The eggplant pizza is very good. The service was also great.
I didnâ€™t get to eat here. Thereâ€™s a cute outdoor seating area. Iâ€™ve attached the latest menu though and will consider coming back.
Got the mozz sticks and the meatball ziti. I was impressed with the food. Service was very nice. I went at a busy time and they cleared up a spare table for me.
